channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘Joker’ Sequel Falls Far Short of Original at the Box Office
item.description: The bleak musical drama is on track to open to around $45 million, less than half of what the 2019 version made on its first weekend.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Signals an Escalation of Military Activity in Gaza
item.description: Israel has also broadened its attacks in Lebanon in recent days, expanding its campaign against Hezbollah, an Iranian-backed ally of Hamas.

item.title: How the Push to Avert a Broader War in Lebanon Fell Apart
item.description: Diplomats thought both Israel and Hezbollah supported a call for a temporary cease-fire. Then Israel killed Hezbollah’s leader.

item.title: Climate Change Is Scorching Stretches of the Amazon River in Brazil
item.description: As a punishing drought dries up stretches of the Amazon River, Brazil is resorting to dredging to try to keep food, medicine and people flowing along ...

item.title: Trump’s Rambling Speeches Reinforce Question of Age
item.description: With the passage of time, the 78-year-old former president’s speeches have grown darker, harsher, longer, angrier, less focused, more profane and incr...

item.title: What It’s Like to Return to Israeli Villages Attacked on Oct. 7
item.description: Along Israel’s border with Gaza, reminders of the trauma of the Hamas-led assault are inescapable as the few who have returned try to start anew.

item.title: How the Push to Avert a Broader War in Lebanon Fell Apart
item.description: Diplomats thought both Israel and Hezbollah supported a call for a temporary cease-fire. Then Israel killed Hezbollah’s leader.

item.title: Each Cava location is worth a whopping $33 million. Its CEO explains how the Chipotle competitor is achieving explosive growth
item.description: Brett Schulman says the chain’s 300% stock growth is not just due to its crazy feta.

item.title: AI assistants are ratting you out for badmouthing your coworkers
item.description: You shouldn’t give an AI assistant more power than a recent college graduate, C-suite exec suggests.

item.title: At a Tennessee Plastics Plant, Sorrow and Uncertainty in Helene’s Wake
item.description: More than a week after workers fled flooding outside their factory, much remains unclear, including how many died.

item.title: Trump joined by Musk on campaign trail in return to scene of July assassination attempt
item.description: Donald Trump picked up where he left off back in July when a gunman tried to assassinate him but only struck his ear.

item.title: Harris Will Appear in a Whirlwind of Interviews, Most of Them Friendly
item.description: After mostly avoiding interviews as her campaign began, the vice president will hold several this week, including with Howard Stern, Stephen Colbert a...

item.title: MG Cyberster brings open-top fun to electric cars at last
item.description: Fortune took a hands-on drive of this much-hyped EV in the Scottish highlands and the potholed streets of London.

item.title: As War in Ukraine Drags On, Dogs Offer Comfort
item.description: Dog ownership has surged over the past two years as people seek companionship. In Kyiv, Yorkies, poodles and bichons frisés now rule the streets.

item.title: Caffeine may be just the exercise booster you need—as long as you don’t over do it, say experts
item.description: “It’s a great performance enhancer,” one expert says. Here’s why it’s important to use the stimulant responsibly.
